content.html: Until you have one developer who forgets to setup a global .gitignore, and his IDE files end up in the repository anyway. With local .gitignore it's enforced no matter what. Good luck convincing a dev. on the other side of the world to setup a global .gitignore just for you ;-)
content.text: Until you have one developer who forgets to setup a global .gitignore, and his IDE files end up in the repository anyway. With local .gitignore it's enforced no matter what. Good luck convincing a dev. on the other side of the world to setup a global .gitignore just for you ;-)

content.html: I don't need to spend too much energy convincing, all I need to do os reject the PR üòà
content.text: I don't need to spend too much energy convincing, all I need to do os reject the PR üòà

content.html: Don't get me wrong, you are absolutely right it belongs in a global .gitignore. Just try to convince everybody else of that, is the hard part.
content.text: Don't get me wrong, you are absolutely right it belongs in a global .gitignore. Just try to convince everybody else of that, is the hard part.

content.html: On the other hand, what is the "harm" of including it in a local one?
content.text: On the other hand, what is the "harm" of including it in a local one?

content.html: The "harm" is that a project's .gitignore file gets unnecessarily messy. Laravel has .idea and .vscode (probably the most popular editors in that ecosystem) in theyr .gitignore, and I don't mind that they do that to reduce friction in PRs at that scale.
content.text:
The "harm" is that a project's .gitignore file gets unnecessarily messy. 

Laravel has .idea and .vscode (probably the most popular editors in that ecosystem) in theyr .gitignore, and I don't mind that they do that to reduce friction in PRs at that scale.

content.html: Setting up a global .gitignore file, @sebdedeyne If everyone would commit their environment-specific .gitignore rules, we'd have a long list to maintain! My repository doesn't care about your editor configuration. sebastiandedeyne.com/setting-up-a-g‚Ä¶
content.text:
Setting up a global .gitignore file, @sebdedeyne

If everyone would commit their environment-specific .gitignore rules, we'd have a long list to maintain! My repository doesn't care about your editor configuration.

sebastiandedeyne.com/setting-up-a-g‚Ä¶

content.html: Make your repos agnostic of personal environment files and folders by using a global .gitignore sebastiandedeyne.com/setting-up-a-g‚Ä¶ #webdev #git #javascript #versioncontrol
content.text: Make your repos agnostic of personal environment files and folders by using a global .gitignore sebastiandedeyne.com/setting-up-a-g‚Ä¶ #webdev #git #javascript #versioncontrol

content.html: TIL you can set a global .gitignore file locally sebastiandedeyne.com/setting-up-a-g‚Ä¶
content.text: TIL you can set a global .gitignore file locally sebastiandedeyne.com/setting-up-a-g‚Ä¶

content.html: I've posted about global gitignore files before: This file could benefit from that very much because it spends 40 lines ignoring every possible editor. #git #webdev sebastiandedeyne.com/setting-up-a-g‚Ä¶
content.text: I've posted about global gitignore files before: This file could benefit from that very much because it spends 40 lines ignoring every possible editor.  #git #webdev sebastiandedeyne.com/setting-up-a-g‚Ä¶

content.html: A lot of developers still need to hear this: stop polluting your project's .gitignore with personal tool configuration like `.vscode` and `.idea`. Get on the global `~/.gitignore` level! sebastiandedeyne.com/setting-up-a-g‚Ä¶
content.text:
A lot of developers still need to hear this: stop polluting your project's .gitignore with personal tool configuration like `.vscode` and `.idea`. 

Get on the global `~/.gitignore` level!

sebastiandedeyne.com/setting-up-a-g‚Ä¶
